author: rokejulianlockhart
body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to reproduce it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).


### Steps to reproduce

To reproduce this problem:
1. Download [this](http://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/files/8815209/1654094598.txt); and:
2. “`Set-Location`” to where the file is stored.
3. Invoke “`cat '1654094598.txt'`”.


### Expected behaviour

The corrupted file should not be passed to the interpreter.


### Actual behaviour
Corrupted text is provided to the interpreter when I observe [the output of invocation of “`script -a`”](http://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/files/8815209/1654094598.txt), which appears to be corrupt, via “`cat`”.


### Error details

```console
PS /> Get-Error               
PS />
```

Weirdly, nothing erroneous appears to have been recorded.


### Environment data

```powershell
PS /> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.3.0-preview.4
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.3.0-preview.4
OS                             Linux 5.19.0-0.rc0.20220526gitbabf0bb978e3.4.fc37.x86_64 #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Thu May 26 16:02:31 UTC 2022
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

PS />
```


### Visuals

[This depicts the problem.](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/files/8815178/1654094478.zip)

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: Please provides repro steps. The issue will be closed if repro steps are not provided.

comments.author: rokejulianlockhart
comments.body: @daxian-dbw, what more must I provide? I am unable to comprehend why "https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/files/8815209/1654094598.txt" and "https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/files/8815178/1654094478.zip" are inadequate.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
Please provide steps that can reproduce the issue you observed.

The transcript log file may provide additional information, but it's not repro steps. For example, I cannot find `script -a` in the log file. If all you did was `cat $ENV:HOME/typescript`, then the `$ENV:HOME/typescript` file should be provided to help reproduce the issue.

comments.author: rokejulianlockhart
comments.body: @daxian-dbw, I should have expected that. I apologize. I am able to provide the file, but I know not whether it shall contain any credentials. Are you able to limit observation of it to trusted contributors?

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: Once you uploaded the file, it will be visible to everyone. Please scrub your file and try narrow down the needed content for reproducing the issue. The simpler the repro steps are, the easier for investigation.

comments.author: rokejulianlockhart
comments.body:
@daxian-dbw, [this file](http://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/files/8856878/PowerShell_transcript.1653307616.%2BSym2k0I.20220601134519.txt) causes this problem when invoked for me, as [this record](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/files/8856893/1654640138.txt) demonstrates.

(Although "http://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/files/8856878/PowerShell_transcript.1653307616.%2BSym2k0I.20220601134519.txt" is not the original file that referenced, it causes the problem identically, so that is probably irrelevant. I am unable to locate the original file.)

PaulHigin
comments.body:
@BEEDELLROKEJULIANLOCKHART  This issue is not written in the required form, so that it can be easily read and comprehended.  For more information please see PowerShell guidelines for writing issue reports.  Essentially, this is what the issue report needs to contain:

- Short description of issue
- Set of reproducible steps that demonstrate the issue, as short and concise as possible.
- Expected results of reproducible steps
- Actual results of reproducible steps

comments.author: rokejulianlockhart
comments.body:
@PaulHigin, I adhered strictly to the template that GitHub provided, and consequently attempted to provide all of the information that was requested. I have additionally provided a video that demonstrates the problem, and the original file that causes it, and specified the commands to utilize to reproduce the problem. I am willing to answer any questions of yours.

I consequently do not know how my description of the problem does not adhere to what "https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/17467#issuecomment-1163267570" specifies, so please specify. However, I have attempted to improve the report, so please evaluate it again.

comments.author: StevenBucher98
comments.body: I believe `cat` does the same thing on linux machines. Would you consider this to be a security issue @PaulHigin? I am not sure if makes sense to changing this behavior

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body: @StevenBucher98   Is what a security issue?  What behavior are you thinking about changing?  Please be specific.

comments.author: StevenBucher98
comments.body: @PaulHigin Having `cat` aka `Get-Content` display text from a corrupted file. it is being proposed to not have corrupted files passed to PowerShell interpreter from this command but I don't believe this is something that needs to be changed.

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body: No, dumping file contents to the terminal, even when it may contain sensitive information, is not a security issue.

comments.author: rokejulianlockhart
comments.body:
This certainly is replicated by `bash`, so I shall close this since you agree that it is desirable. However, I am unable to understand why passing the dumped file's content to the interpreter is desirable. I thought that cat should solely provide the content of the file to the console, rather than attempt to invoke any of what it contains.

Is this not even a bug with cat?

title: Corrupted text provided by command is automatically invoked by PowerShell during an interactive session.
